DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare postoperative immune function (e.g. NK cell activity) of fentanyl-based analgesic regimen versus local anesthetic wound infiltration-based anlagesic regimen after laparoscopic colorectal surgery
DOC.brief_title: Effects of Postoperative Pain Management on Immune Function After Laparoscopic Resection of Colorectal Cancer
DOC.criteria: ASA class IIII 2080 years old elective laparoscopic colorectal surgery for cancer drug allergy significant renal or hepatic impairment sign of infection
DOC.keyword: analgesia; colorectal surgery; immunity; local anesthetics; opioids
